revision.text:
{{pp-pc1}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2011}} {{Infobox person |name= Lucas Cruikshank |image=Lucas Cruikshank by Gage Skidmore.jpg |image_size= |alt= |caption=Cruikshank in 2014 |birth_name=Lucas Alan Cruikshank |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1993|8|29|mf=y}} |birth_place=[[Columbus, Nebraska]], U.S. |residence= |nationality= [[Americans|American]] |other_names= |citizenship= |alma_mater= |occupation= {{flatlist| * [[Actor]] * [[YouTube personality]] }} |years_active= 2005–present |known_for= Creator/star of [[Fred Figglehorn|FЯED]] |notable_works= ''[[FRED (show)|Fred]]'', ''[[Marvin Marvin]]'' |home_town= [[Columbus, Nebraska]], United States | height = 5' 10" |title= |awards= |website= {{URL|http://www.heyitsfred.com/}} {{URL|https://www.youtube.com/Lucas/}} |module= {{Infobox person/Internet info |web alias= ''Fred'', ''Lucas'' |web host service= [[YouTube]] |meme= |signature phrase="Hey! It's Fred!" }} }} '''Lucas Alan Cruikshank''' (born August 29, 1993) is an American [[actor]] and [[YouTube personality]] who created the character [[Fred Figglehorn]] and the associated ''Fred'' series for his channel on the [[video hosting service|video-sharing]] website [[YouTube]] in late 2005.{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/media/online/andrew-keen-on-new-media-kids-with-cameras-lead-the-way-in-giving-web-users-their-daily-fred-878508.html |title=Andrew Keen on New Media: Kids with cameras lead the way in giving web users their daily Fred |work=[[The Independent]] |author=Andrew Keen |date=July 28, 2008 |accessdate=October 26, 2008}} These videos are centered on Fred Figglehorn, a fictional six-year-old who has a dysfunctional home life and "anger management issues".{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2008/06/30/1214677897205.html |title=Fast-talking Fred is the toast of YouTube |author=Stephen Hutcheon, with Tom Burton |date=June 20, 2008 |accessdate=October 26, 2008 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald}} == Early life == Lucas Alan Cruikshank was born on August 29, 1993,{{cite web |last1=Cruikshank |first1=Lucas|title=Draw My Life - Lucas Cruikshank |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w-p1xx8kkhA |publisher=YouTube|accessdate=October 27, 2014|format=Adobe Flash|date=Mar 14, 2013|quote=Unofficial transcript is at [http://lybio.net/tag/lucas-alan-cruikshank Lybio.net]}} and raised in Columbus, Nebraska, where he attended [[Lakeview High School (Nebraska)|Lakeview High School]]. He is the son of Molly Jeanne (née Duffy) and Dave Alan Cruikshank.Freeman, Eric. (September 23, 2010) [http://columbustelegram.com/news/local/article_898e1e80-c719-11df-a9ed-001cc4c002e0.html Fred a hit in TV movie]. Columbustelegram.com. Retrieved 2012-08-20.[http://themeehanfamily.com/oconnor/1911.htm The O'Connor Family Lucas Alan Cruikshank]. Themeehanfamily.com (November 14, 2010). Retrieved 2012-08-20.[https://archive.is/20130122200951/http://www.feedagg.com/feed/228765/See-todays-new-hot-trend See today's new hot trend]. Feedagg.com (May 23, 2009). Retrieved 2012-08-20. He has five sisters and two brothers.[http://journalstar.com/lifestyles/article_de7c0502-bc6c-5681-a780-f5af1f2311dd.html Columbus' 'Fred' becomes an Internet star : The (402)/411]. Journalstar.com (October 6, 2008). Retrieved 2012-08-20. Cruikshank is openly [[Homosexuality|gay]]. In a YouTube video released August 20, 2013, he [[coming out|came out]] saying "I'm gay. I feel so weird saying it on camera. But my family and friends have known for like three years. I just haven't felt the need to announce it on the Internet."{{cite web |last=Cruikshank |first=Lucas |title=ARE YOU GAY?!? |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-7UWcrDdKWs |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=August 20, 2013}}{{cite web |last=Eby |first=Margaret |title=Lucas Cruikshank, star of Nickelodeon's 'Fred,' comes out as gay |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/lucas-cruikshank-star-nickelodeon-fred-gay-article-1.1432098 |work=Daily News |location=New York |accessdate=August 20, 2013 |date=August 20, 2013}}{{cite web |title='I'm gay': Fred star Lucas Cruikshank comes out on YouTube as he answers questions from fans in video |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2398477/Fred-star-Lucas-Cruikshank-comes-gay-YouTube-Q-A.html |work=Daily Mail |accessdate=August 20, 2013 |date=August 20, 2013}}{{cite news |last=De Hoyos |first=Brandon |title=Lucas Cruikshank, 'Fred' Actor, Comes Out as Gay Man |url=http://news92fm.com/376774/lucas-cruikshank-gay |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141009064012/http://news92fm.com/376774/lucas-cruikshank-gay |archivedate=2014-10-09 |accessdate=August 20, 2013 |newspaper=News 92 FM |date=August 20, 2013}} Cruikshank met his boyfriend Matthew Fawcus "from afar" at a [[gay club]], with Cruikshank and Fawcus being introduced to each other by fellow gay YouTuber [[Kingsley (YouTuber)|Kingsley]].{{cite news|title=Lucas Cruikshank Officially Confirms He's Dating Boyfriend Matthew Fawcus - Superfame|url=http://superfame.com/post/lucas-cruikshank-officially-confirms-hes-dating-boyfriend-matthew-fawcus/|accessdate=March 4, 2017|work=Superfame|date=January 14, 2015}} == Career == === Fred === {{main article|Fred Figglehorn}} Cruikshank, while testing character ideas, created the Fred character in a Halloween video, and uploaded it to a YouTube channel that he had started with his two cousins. Upon the success of Fred, he started a video series, and set up the Fred channel in April 2008.{{cite web |title=Lucas Cruikshank aka Fred Exclusive Interview: The Partners Project Episode 19 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pLJ7CoXZwkM |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=December 30, 2011 |author=partnersproject |date=April 21, 2011}} By April 2009, the channel had over one million subscribers, making it the first YouTube channel to do so, and the most subscribed channel at the time.{{cite web |url=http://www.batchbuzz.com/detailedStoryDefault.php?id=751 |title=BB Suggests: The Best of Web TV |author=Editorial Team |date=November 13, 2008 |accessdate=November 16, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091117194346/http://www.batchbuzz.com/detailedStoryDefault.php?id=751 |archivedate=November 17, 2009 |df=mdy-all }} In December 2009, Cruikshank filmed [[Fred: The Movie]], which aired on [[Nickelodeon]] in September 2010. Nickelodeon created a franchise surrounding the character, and began producing the sequel in March 2011.{{cite news |url=http://mediadecoder.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/03/24/fred-the-movie-lands-on-nickelodeon/ |work=The New York Times |title='Fred: The Movie' Lands on Nickelodeon – Media Decoder Blog – ''The New York Times''. |first=Brooks |last=Barnes |date=March 24, 2010}} [[Fred 2: Night of the Living Fred]] aired on October 22, 2011, also on Nickelodeon. In 2012 [[Fred: The Show]] aired, consisting of twenty 11-minute episodes, and a third movie called [[Fred 3: Camp Fred]]. === Sponsorship and appearances === In the '''Fred''' series, Cruikshank promotes various products and movies. He is seen using a [[Zipit Wireless Messenger (Z2)|Zipit]],{{cite web |title=Fred Goes Swimming |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nEqwKNNQBwc |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} as well as his own products{{cite web |title=Fred Finds a Creepy Doll |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QURja9e_EnQ |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} and T-shirts.{{cite web |title=Fred Faces a Dirty Campaign |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhOdamcG2v4 |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} In addition to promoting his own movies and albums, Cruikshank has also promoted the movies ''[[City of Ember]]'',{{cite web |title=FRED WANTS TO BE A STAR!! (City of Fred?!) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VsHrInVlILA |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} [[Year One (film)|''Year One'']],{{cite web |title=Fred Gets Dissed at Bible School |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P-AEH6YVEHs |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} and ''[[Adventures of Power]]'',{{cite web |title=Lucas Gets Kidnapped! |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iB2OEKn7i-Y |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} and the artist Kev Blaze.{{cite web |title=Kev Blaze feat. FRED – "Watch How I Do This (remix)" |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Zc7Wt4WBEE |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=January 6, 2012}} He has made a [[guest appearance]] as both "Fred" and himself on Nickelodeon's ''[[iCarly]]'' in "iMeet Fred", which originally aired on February 16, 2009.{{cite news |url=http://www.businessweek.com/technology/content/nov2008/tc20081118_508970.htm |title='Fred' Cranks Up the YouTube Views and Ad Dollars |last=Albrecht |first=Chris |date=November 18, 2008 |work=[[Business Week]] |accessdate=July 7, 2009}} Cruikshank appeared in the ''[[Hannah Montana]]'' episode "Come Fail Away", which aired December 6, 2009.{{cite web |title=Come Fail Away |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1540545/ |publisher=Internet Movie Database |accessdate=December 30, 2011 |year=2009}} He appeared at the 2009 Teen Choice Awards as well as the [[2010 Kids' Choice Awards]] presenting awards to winners off-stage. In 2011, he appeared on the [[Cartoon Network]] [[Hall of Game Awards]] and in an episode of ''[[Supah Ninjas]]''. In 2012 and 2013 he starred as the lead in the Nickelodeon television show ''[[Marvin Marvin]]'', as an alien "teenage" boy adjusting to human life. === Other work === Cruikshank was originally a part of JKL Productions, a group comprising twins '''J'''on and '''K'''atie Smet and '''L'''ucas Cruikshank, their cousin. Cruikshank formally left the group and deleted his individual videos. In January 2009 he set up his own channel, called "lucas", in which he appears as himself. Since May 2013, Cruikshank has regularly released vlogs on his "lucas" channel. As of August 2018, lucas, now called "Lucas", has over 2,818,700 subscribers.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/lucas/about|title=Lucas|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=YouTube|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|accessdate=June 19, 2018}} Cruikshank made an appearance on Brandon Rogers' ''Four Million Subscriber Freakout'' video after the latter gained four million subscribers as of June 2018.{{cote web|title=Four Million Subscriber Freakout|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EovG1QzAL2k|publisher=Brandon Rogers|accessdate=June 15, 2018|date=June 10, 2018}} == Filmography == {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Films ! Year ! Title ! Role |- | 2010 |''[[Fred: The Movie]]'' |Fred Figglehorn / Derf |- | 2011 |''[[Fred 2: Night of the Living Fred]]'' |Fred Figglehorn / Derf |- | 2012 |''[[Fred 3: Camp Fred]]'' |Fred Figglehorn |- |} {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Television ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" | Notes |- | 2006–11 | ''[[Fred (YouTube)|Fred]]'' | [[Fred Figglehorn]] | Lead role |- | 2010 | ''[[The Annoying Orange]]'' | Fred | Episode: "Orange vs FRED" |- | 2013 | ''The Flipside'' | Henry | Episode: "Me, Myself and My Conscience" |- | 2013–present | ''Lucas'' | Host | |- | 2014 | ''Cute Combat'' | Host | |- |} == Discography == ===Comedy albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of studio albums, with selected chart positions and certifications ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="3"| Peak chart
